alert.note: Alert for Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 6:46PM MDT until June 24 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Golden Valley and Wheatland. In south central Montana, Stillwater and Sweet Grass. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 643 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rainfall has fallen along a slow moving line of showers and thunderstorms. This is in an area that saw excessive rainfall over the past 36 hours. The ground is saturated and most of this rainfall will runoff. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shawmut. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
